intro: Otholobium glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular otholobium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has compound leaves with stipules and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
